definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
abbr. for Xiamen or Amoy 廈門|厦门[Xia4 men2], Fujian

sentences.english: There’re blue sky，beautiful trees and big buildings ahead.
sentences.chinese: 晴空丽日，前面是婀娜多姿的树木和高楼大厦。

sentences.english: The Wong Tai Sin Temple is much older than the surrounding high-rise buildings.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠比较周围的高楼大厦年代久远得多。

sentences.english: We know he can leap over tall buildings and pick up cars with bare hands.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，超人可以跳越高楼大厦，徒手抓起汽车。

sentences.english: Colorfully lit high- risers give off dazzling light in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 多姿多彩的高楼大厦，在夜色中绚烂夺目。

sentences.english: The fields where I played as a child have been built over.
sentences.chinese: 我儿时玩耍的那些田野现在已盖满了高楼大厦。

sentences.english: The heavy haze has covered many buildings in our country, including the Petronas Twin Tower.
sentences.chinese: 烟霾的已经盖过了我国的许多高楼大厦，包括双峰塔。

sentences.english: Murky brown water grows to roof tops and lapped around the high-rises.
sentences.chinese: 浑浊的棕色河水已经升到屋顶，拍打着高楼大厦。

sentences.english: The streets are all lined with tall buildings on both sides.
sentences.chinese: 街道的两旁都耸立着高楼大厦。

sentences.english: Outside the city walls is the new city with serried tall buildings.
sentences.chinese: 而城墙外则是高楼大厦林立的新城。

sentences.english: From a modest counter within the post office, it has now developed into a modern bank housed in tall buildings.
sentences.chinese: 由邮政局里的一个小柜台发展到现代化高楼大厦。

sentences.english: THEY do not build high towers in the Land of All-I-Have-Found.
sentences.chinese: 在万有无缺的国度里，人们不修建高楼大厦。

sentences.english: It develops very fast. Tall buildings are the symbol of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 它发展迅猛，高楼大厦是上海的标志。

sentences.english: It is my father who erects the buildings higher and higher.
sentences.chinese: 是爸爸建起了新世纪的高楼大厦。

sentences.english: My father who erects the buildings higher and higher.
sentences.chinese: 是爸爸建起了新世纪的高楼大厦。

sentences.english: I am impressed with how many morden buildings there in shenzhen .
sentences.chinese: 我对深圳那么多的高楼大厦印象很深。

sentences.english: But high-rise buildings are not all that Pudong has.
sentences.chinese: 但是，高楼大厦并非浦东的全部。

definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
